Posts.Content: Feb 7, 2008 09:41PM leesa wrote: Hi I too was just diagnosed with a chest wall recurrance, it's actually in my armpit about and inch from where it was originally.  I had four dense dose A/C the first time along with a mastectomy no rads.  I'm just trying to figure out what I'm getting this time, I know I need it all this time, chemo rads and surgery.  I think were in the same boat. I'm triple negative just like the last time.  I had bone scan and CT's all clear, One onc says taxotere and cytonan, every 3 weeks times four.  What is eveyones elses thoughts.
Posts.Title: Recurrence in Chest Wall CAS leesa

Posts.Content: Apr 23, 2008 07:50AM leesa wrote: Hi I start chemo tomorrow. 4-23, Taxotere and Carboplatin,  I developed a blood clot around my port so they have to delay the avastin, until I'm off Lovenex a blood thinner. This is my 2nd time.  I was diagnosed with BC April 27, 06 and again in Jan. of 08. Just because you've been there ,doesn't make it any easier, I'm just more resigned that this is the only way to beat this monster.  So I'm an April member too.  Best of luck to all who are having tx tomorrow, It seems I'll be with an amazing bunch of ladies. Good Luck and God be with all of us. Leesa
Posts.Title: Starting chemo in April haykat57 angie27

Posts.Content: Feb 28, 2008 12:47AM leesa wrote: Hi Chris, I had a/c in 2006 and I finally got a haircut last month!!!!  I look great!!! Well you guessed it.... It"s BACK.  I'll start chemo in March.  Caroplatin, taxatere and avastin.  Hair today gone tomorrow.  The good this is I know where all the cheap wig stores are.... And I know I'm going to beat it this, this time, just like you will.  Maybe we can start our own chemo group.  March Madness, March of ??? 2nd time around ??? well you come up with the name, I'm not feeling witty tonight. Does anyone else know about these drugs, info please...side effects and so on??? thank you all. Leesa
